job_title: Chief of Staff in New Orleans, LA
pros: Benefits are comprehensive and LPHI covers a lot of the cost Generous leave structure Flexible Supportive Innovative
cons: Some major shifts in operations leadership over the past 6 months, so there could be culture shifts

job_title: Program Coordinator in New Orleans, LA
pros: Great people, partners, and community members Flexible work schedule (hybrid, adjusted hours) Built in vacation days Passionate and involved CEO New office for those who like to go into the office
cons: The pay leaves something to be desired 1-2 month hiring process Teams can feel separated from each other Still working one creating 'company standards' (i.e. evaluation documents, project strategy plans) Excessive professional development plan - there is not time to review or do extra training for most

job_title: Associate Visual Designer in New Orleans, LA
pros: Relax atmosphere Projects with great opportunities Great co-workers (some, not all)
cons: Leadership was very toxic Some leaders had hidden agendas Little to no career advancement if you're in support positions Little to no policing of unproductive workers

job_title: Data Architect in New Orleans, LA
pros: Flexible working hours, a tons of holidays and the flat organization structure.
cons: The salary is lower than the company
Uncertainty about funding available for positions

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Orleans, LA
pros: Generous benefits, including flextime; depending on your supervisor, opportunity to be a big fish in a little pond; staff below director level passionate and mission driven
cons: Unnecessarily hierarchical and risk adverse; toxic office politics with advancement decisions based on perceived political connections as opposed to actual merit & skill; low morale and high turnover that is continuously whitewashed by management but never actually addressed; employee development and growth highly dependent on who is your supervisor

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Orleans, LA
pros: The Institute does amazing community work. Working there will give you the warm and fuzzies. The staff is great to work with since everyone is working toward the greater good. Benefits are great. Lots of great life/work balance.
cons: Pay is lower than you will find in the public sector. You have to be willing to deal with a lot of red tape and bureaucracy due to government related funding sources. A lot of egos exist and academics who love to hear themselves talk and sometimes talk down to you. You will also likely hit the glass ceiling faster than you think.

review_title: Good place to get a chance of internship
job_title: Research Assistant in New Orleans, LA
pros: A lot of students or even some working people around can get a chance of intern in LPHI in summer or each January, since there are lots of project there. Usually the  payment is 12/hr
cons: less knowledge can be learned there, mostly is doing data entry or interviewing people, you may not get touch to the design session or quality control session until you are the most outstanding person among all the interns.

job_title: Applications Developer in New Orleans, LA
pros: Some of the best coworkers I have ever had. The workplace is diverse and seeks to make Louisiana a healthier state.
cons: A lot of the work is grant based, a loss of grant could mean a loss of income. This isn't necessarily a negative on the employer but on the realities of working for an organization that bases much of its income on grants.

job_title: Research Assistant in New Orleans, LA
pros: Great experience! Terrific networking opportunities! Great overall work!
cons: It was a short term job and even with that position, it did not give me an advantage when I was applying to other full time positions.

job_title: Program Manager in New Orleans, LA
pros: Flexible with time for staff with family ,
cons: the method of who is promoted is not fair, it depends on who likes you and not the skill set of staff

review_title: Very good company with a great mission
job_title: Health IT Project Manager in New Orleans, LA
pros: Opportunities to lead and set your own course.
cons: I personally had some poor managers, but they're no longer with the company.

pros: Great place to work! People are very friendly and helpful with a great team dynamic!
cons: Projects funded through grants and can take quite some time to be executed.

job_title: Patient Engagement Consultant in New Orleans, LA
cons: Long hours for rate of pay.
